items.description: First CAR-T ever approved by FDA, for acute lymphoblastic leukemia

details.Notes: Approved in Aug 2017.  Initially approved for pediatric and young adult patients with a form of acute lymphoblastic leukemia (ALL). Later it also got approved for adult patients with relapsed or refractory (r/r) large B-cell lymphoma after two or more lines of systemic therapy.

items.description: 2nd US approved CAR-T, cleared for several B-cell lymphomas including DLBCL & follicular lymphoma. 2022 won earlier use in lymphoma

details.Notes: Approved in Oct 2017. It is approved for adult patients with relapsed or refractory large B-cell lymphoma after two or more lines of systemic therapy.

items.description: 3rd CAR-T approved, first for mantle cell lymphoma, extended to acute lymphoblastic leukemia

details.Notes: Approved in July 2020. It is approved for adult patients with relapsed or refractory mantle cell lymphoma (MCL).
Approved in Feb 2021 for types of large B-cell lymphoma after at least two or more types of systemic therapy.

items.description: 5th CAR-T approved, but 1st for multiple myeloma

details.Notes: Approved in March 2021. Targets B-cell maturation antigen (BCMA).
Approved in Feb 2022. Targets BCMA.

These bispecific drugs work by binding simultaneously to proteins on tumor cells and on T cells, inducing an immune attack on cancer. The first drugs to gain approval treated leukemia and lymphoma based on protein targets distinctive to those diseases.
Binds to two proteins important in blood clotting to help stem bleeding in people with hemophilia. Targets: CD19 x CD3

items.description: 3rd bispecific antibody approved in U.S. in May 2021

details.Notes: The FDA approved Rybrevant to treat a specific mutation in a cancer-linked protein that’s thought to be present in about 2% of patients with non-small cell lung cancer. Targets: EGFR x cMET

items.description: Approved in Jan 2022, fourth FDA-approved therapy for “wet” age-related macular degeneration

details.Notes: 4th FDA-approved therapy for “wet” age-related macular degeneration. VEGF x Ang-2

items.description: Approved in Oct 2022, first-of-its kind for multiple myeloma

details.Notes: Targets BCMA x CD3. One of a wave to target this protein found on malignant cells in multiple myeloma. GlaxoSmithKline was the first to target BCMA with an antibody-drug conjugate Blenrep OK'd in 2020. The CAR-T Abecma also targets BCMA. Tecvayli was J&J's 4th approved treatment for multiple myeloma.
Relapsed or refractory diffuse large B-cell lymphoma (DLBCL). CD20 x CD3
Follicular lymphoma. CD20 x CD3
Targets GPR5CD x CD3

items.description: FDA considering for adults and maternal use in 2023.

details.Notes: Advisers voted 14-0 and 10-4 (safety for infant use and a closer 7-4 for older adults use in separate 2023 votes, approvals due August and May, respectively.

items.description: First RSV vaccine to win U.S. approval, in May 2023.

details.Notes: Cleared only for use in adults 60 years or older.

details.Integration: Episomal, with 0.1% genomic. You can't say liver directed AAV gene therapy will be permanent, doesn't survive cell division or apoptosis. Max insertion size: Less than 8kb
details.Notes: XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX

details.Integration: Episomal. Short term effect of 1-2 weeks. 5kb
Episomal. Targets are CNS, muscle, heart, liver. Large packaging capacity between 30-50kb
details.Examples: Krystal Biotech's Vyjuvek, first topical gene therapy OK'd in May 2023, for "butterfly children" with dystrophic epidermolysis bullosa.

items.description: first topical (and redosable) gene therapy, for dystrophic epidermolysis bullosa. Sixth GT for inherited approved.

details.Notes: Approved May 2023

details.Prevnar-20: 20-strain pneumococcal shot OK'd for infants and children in April 2023 and OK'd in adults in 2021.

details.Victoza, Saxenda (liraglutide): Victoza - daily shot for diabetes approved in 2010Saxenda - Novo pioneered the use of insulin-stimulating diabetes drugs as weight loss treatments when it launched a high-dose version Victoza as Saxenda in 2014.
details.Ozempic: Approved in 2017 for Type 2 diabetes - injectable semaglutide in 0.5, 1.0 and 2.0 mg doses
details.Rybelsus: Approved 2019 for Type 2 diabetes - pill of semaglutide in 3, 7 and 14 mg doses
details.Wegovy: Approved in 2021 for weight loss - injectable semaglutide in escalating doses to begin and then 2.4 mg for maintenance
details.Experimental obesity pill: Once daily pill of 50 mg semaglutide Novo plans to ask for approval after a Phase 3 study showed it help patients lose an average 15.1% of weight

details.Trulicity (dulaglutide): Weekly shot for Type 2 diabetes approved in 2014
details.Mounjaro (tirzepatide): Shot approved to control diabetes in May 2022Works by stimulating two hormones, GLP-1 and GIP

details.Basaglar: Long-acting human insulin analog. Partner Boehringer Ingelheim
details.Jardiance: Approved for type 2 diabetes. Cleared expanded use in heart failure patients. Partner Boehringer Ingelheim
